stimulusHtml: Based on the image, which of the following conclusions can best be drawn to describe the conditions in the Long Island Sound?

features.html: Long Island Sound is a body of water off the northeast coast of the United States. Over nine million people live in the small watershed area that feeds into the sound. To determine the effect of the population density on the watershed, scientists measured the oxygen content of bottom waters in the sound. The data from late summer 2013 are displayed in the map below.

choicesHtml: The sound has high levels of dissolved oxygen as a result of storm water runoff from urban areas.
The sound has high levels of phosphorus and nitrogen from an increase in the number of producers.
The sound has large numbers of phytoplankton blooms that are decomposing and consumed by respiring bacteria.
The sound has high numbers of respiring fish populations and very low turbidity.
